PHYSICAL.name: Physical Framework
PHYSICAL.description: Traditional physical dimensional framework (e.g., Length, Mass, Time).

L.name: Length
L.description: Distance between two points in space.

M.name: Mass
M.description: Amount of matter in an object.

T.name: Time
T.description: Duration of an event or interval.

K.name: Temperature
K.description: Measure of average kinetic energy of particles.

C.name: Luminous Intensity
C.description: Perceived power of light in a given direction.

COMPUTATION.name: Computation Framework
COMPUTATION.description: Computer science dimensional framework (e.g., Time, Space, Complexity).

T.name: Time
T.description: Duration of an event or interval.

N.name: Complexity
N.description: Measure of interconnectedness or intricacy in a system.

SOFTWARE.name: Software Framework
SOFTWARE.description: Software architecture dimensional framework (e.g., Time, Data, Connectivity).

T.name: Time
T.description: Duration of an event or interval.

A.name: Capacity
A.description: Maximum amount of data that can be stored/processed.

CUSTOM.name: Custom Framework
CUSTOM.description: User-defined dimensional framework for specific use cases.

IN.name: Input Variables
IN.description: Variables that influence the system (e.g., known inputs).

OUT.name: Output Variables
OUT.description: Variable that represent the results of the analysis.

CTRL.name: Control Variables
CTRL.description: Variables used to control or constrain the system (e.g., constants).

COMPUTED.name: Computed Coefficients
COMPUTED.description: Coefficients directly calculated using the Dimensional Matrix.

DERIVED.name: Derived Coefficients
DERIVED.description: Coefficients obtained by combining or manipulating Computed Coefficients.

SYM.name: Symbolic Mode
SYM.description: Analysis for symbolic processable parameters (e.g., 'z = x + y').
